channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @ZachWeiner Company towns make economic sense, because opening a store requires a capital investment, and who has more capital than the mining company? But exploiting the workers up to a point also makes economic sense.
@ZachWeiner Hmmm. I’ve heard that, and I think from someone who grew up in a company town in West Virginia. However, it’s possible that it was union propaganda that doesn’t reflect actual experience.

Question for my friends knowledgeable on 20th century American antisemitism: Were Italians really nine times more likely to be seen as “the worst citizens” than were the Jews in 1939? https://t.co/E6Gk0tUY9d
@profmusgrave As a Jew, I don’t know whether to be flattered, offended, or disbelieving.
@DanielSeidemann @kampeas Not so rare in America, my friend. https://t.co/pyb8klIbNW

@AkivaMCohen I really believe the decision by Democrats not to campaign against crazy Republican governors was a fatal turning point in our country’s history.
@AkivaMCohen Republican embraced the craziest 25% of this country and paid no price. Even though the large majority of voters in VA and NJ were happily vaxxed.
@MarcusBlimi @DBashIdeas Working your kids up to Pesach slowly. Sensible.
@onthemainline The old trick of low level streak hoods rebranding themselves as melamdim. That’s “Reb Sticky Itzie” to you!
@Foone Time to learn you some APL!
@matthewstoller “The news watch never stops!”
https://t.co/d5MZiDcSdM
Sure, let’s clone the asteroid that killed the dinosaurs. What could possibly go wrong with a Jurassic rock? https://t.co/Hl1hlpAEMb
@trekonomics So no free Borscht course. Yet.
@anniemollie Glad it worked better than my attempt to interest my child in the sport of competitive napping.
@EladNehorai Maybe “authoritarian religion” for short?
@EladNehorai How do you define fundamentalism?
@DavidNeiwert I’m afraid it’s very encouraging. Just for the wrong sort of people.

@thislouis @streickercenter @uclamaje @MarkKligman1 — Would you be interested in commenting about the new David Broza Friday night server? I’d love to set up a time to call you if you can dm me your contact info. Thanks!
@smallbeerpress What a cover!

Do I know anyone who follows contemporary synagogue music? I’m writing a piece about David Broza’s new musical setting for the Friday night service, commissioned by Temple Emanu-El’s @streickercenter and I’d love to speak with someone who could help contextualize it.
Info on the new album and services featuring this new music is at David’s website. https://t.co/OITGpsIxz7
@pdnell @nytimes One reason why the Times isn’t all in on democracy.
@pdnell @nytimes Gonna be hard to get juries to unanimously convict white supremacies revolutionaries. .

When I was thinking about the halachic parameters of journalism as a yeshiva student long ago, reporting on arrests was the most problematic situation, since the person was still legally innocent. https://t.co/ae6kYsPpI8
Obviously, not reporting on arrests is harmful for society, since it makes it easier to arrest truly innocent people without accountability.
And there are many situations where it’s appropriate for people to factor in that a person has been accused of a crime when dealing with them.
Removing mug shots from arrest reports seems a reasonable balance and is probably the correct moral choice.
The definitive takedown of Christian missionaries. All the rest is commentary. https://t.co/Jeere2RieP
